cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi SSW of Panama City, FL / 170 mi SW of Apalachicola, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving north this morning, then turning northeast toward the Florida Panhandle and across the Southeast U.S. before exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near Panama City–Mexico Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border westward to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border (tropical-storm warning – east of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast from Alabama/Florida border through Florida Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gale-force gusts (25–35 kt) possible on 10 Oct as Michael’s western outer bands brush the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation less than 2 ft possible; significant surge (≥3 ft) not expected at Pascagoula.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands; most guidance keeps totals below 2 inches at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas may disrupt pilot/berthing operations even though the core passes well east.
